questiontext.text: The value of a variable X was measured in 6 subjects with the following results: 20, 27, 18, 24, 15, 22. When we use a one-sample T test the null hypothesis that Î¼ = 24, at a two-sided risk of 5%, the conclusion should be:

answer.text: The result is not significant, H0 is not rejected

feedback.text: The result is not significant, H0 is not rejected: Correct

answer.text: The result is significant, H0 is not rejected

feedback.text: The result is significant, H0 is not rejected: Incorrect

answer.text: The result is not significant, H0 is rejected

feedback.text: The result is not significant, H0 is rejected: Incorrect

answer.text: The result is significant, H0 is rejected

feedback.text: The result is significant, H0 is rejected: Incorrect
